{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3130917,"name":"","username":"Wing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wing/{size}/175245_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T23:53:01.373Z","cooked":"

We recently just got and assembled our MK4i modules from Andymark and begun testing them when we noticed some strange occurancs. When running both the drive and turn motors we see gears clashing/motors stalling which is persistent across all modules. Another thing is that the gears seem to be strangely wobbly, we are 100% sure the modules were assembled correctly following the guide. Please see the videos below which help demonstrate these issues:

Turning and Driving

Wobbly Gear

Any insights, thoughts, or comments would be greatly apreciated.

  1. Even though by length these videos fit the shorts format, please use normal youtube uploads. It’s very hard to pause at exact points and impossible to backtrack.
  2. Have you taken that gear off and measured it to see if it is in tolerance or is visibly warped?
  3. Have you tried emailing SDS? (Looks like they’re replying as I type)…

If one motor is ran and the other motor is in coast mode you can get a bit of interaction due to the lower gear reduction. This is a nonissue in practice when the steering motor is PID controlled.

If the hex bore is not broached perfectly straight the large gear can wobble a little. The larger diameter of the gear exaggerates the effect. Is the wobbly gear causing binding? We would be happy to send a replacement.

I would recommend wiping off the globs of extra grease from the gears and surround parts so it doesn’t get flung everywhere.
